intro: Lobelia areolata, commonly known as the dotted lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped with a distinctive white or pale green dot on each leaf. Lobelia areolata is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological importance.
